bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, September 8, 1902

div1.p: Reed discusses finances. He mentions honorary degrees he has been awarded.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, September 8, 1902
div1.opener:
This is the last letter I ever rec'd
from Walter - He died Nov. 23. 1902
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Sept. 8, '02
My darling Sister,
div1.p:
Am
still in the land of
the living & will write
a short note to the
lady whose note
you enclosed- Received
your former letter in
good season, & fully
intended to reply at
once, but something
prevented- How's the
Cook? Still waiting
for her monthly wages?
I haven't at all
forgotten that I
am your debtor for
June, July & August.
Would have sent it
but hadn't the where-
with- About the mid-
dle of June, bills for
my new cottage on
the Mountain began
to come & as I had to
pay them, my funds
were too soon brought
to a low ebb- but I'll
get straightened out
after awhile & then
the cook can resume
business - wish
that I could come
down sometime for
a night & will, if I can.
So Randolph Macon
gave Jimmie D. D?
Good boy! Don't tell
any body, but that
Harvard, at its last
Commencement, in the pres-
ence of Teddie Roosevelt,
gave your youngest broth-
er- A.m., & that this was
followed, next week by
the University of Michigan
with L. L. D! Say, hadn't
Jimmie & I better joined
forces? A.m. M. D. D, D,
L. L. D! wouldn't be a very
light string! Kiss the girls-
